title: Eddie Hearn reveals if Anthony Joshua will follow Tyson Fury into WWE
text:
AJ is preparing to take on Andy Ruiz Jr in their hotly anticipated rematch (Picture: Getty)

Eddie Hearn has praised Tyson Fury for his much talked about WWE appearance but does not believe Anthony Joshua will be following his heavyweight rival into the wrestling ring anytime soon.

Fury stared down Braun Strowman during Smackdown last week in a heated exchange and then came face-to-face with the wrestling star on Raw on Monday night, sparking a mass brawl.

The Gypsy King had to be held back by both security guards and, after seeing them off, a host of wrestlers intervened to prevent the two giants from tearing each other apart.

The heavyweight lineal champion claimed he’d been disrespected by Strowman (Picture: WWE)

Fury’s WWE outings were viewed by millions of people and Hearn was a little envious of the heavyweight’s ‘great promotion’, though it is not a ploy he will be trying with Joshua.

Asked what he made of Fury’s stunt, Hearn told IFL TV: ‘I thought it was great. I mean, I didn’t think his acting was that great, you know when he was doing the fake punches.

‘I love people who think WWE is real. Great promotion. I don’t know who came up with it, but brilliant.’

Asked if Joshua would consider making a WWE appearance of his own – particularly if there was money involved – Hearn continued: ‘No I don’t think he’d be down for that.

‘I don’t think there was any money involved, it was more just great exposure. What was it, 3.8 million people watching? It’s brilliant, great, very clever.

Fury called out Strowman again after their second brawl on Raw (Picture: WWE)

‘Again, it’s another one of those things where people say, “Oh it’s so cringe”. And they just don’t realise the bigger picture.’

Joshua is currently preparing for his rematch with Andy Ruiz Jr in Saudi Arabia in December as he looks to win back the belts he surprisingly lost against the Mexican at Madison Square Garden over the summer.

Fury will hopefully be back in the ring in February next year to face Deontay Wilder if his cuts heal in time, and promoter Frank Warren told Metro.co.uk he wasn’t overly happy to see the Gypsy King risking opening up the gashes as arms flailed in his melee with Strowman.
description: Eddie Hearn has praised Tyson Fury for his much talked about WWE appearance but does not believe Anthony Joshua will be following his heavyweight rival into the wrestling ring anytime...
